newsitem.title: NORWAY: FORECAST - Bergesen 1996 profits seen down.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Bergesen 1996 profits seen down.

text.p: Norway's largest shipping company Bergesen ASA is expected to post sharply lower profits for 1996 compared with a year ago mainly due to net financial items, a Reuter survey of 10 analysts showed on Thursday.

The poll forecast 12-month profits before tax at 147 million crowns against 489 million crowns in the corresponding 1995 period. The expectations included net financial costs of 260 million crowns versus a gain in 1995 of 154 million crowns from the sale of shares.
The analysts' pre-tax result estimates varied widely between 55 million crowns and 254 million crowns. Four analysts recommended to sell the share, two said hold and one said sell.
Many of the analysts expected improved results in the gas and tanker sectors in 1997 and 1998, while dry bulk was seen staying relatively stable.
Bergesen will present full-year 1996 results on February 13.
